{{Incomplete}}
This article intends to list the main events of the life of [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] in a chronological order.

==[[1892]]==
*[[3 January]]: J.R.R. Tolkien is born in [[Bloemfontein]], [[Orange Free State]] (modern South Africa).
*[[31 January]]: Tolkien is baptized at the Anglican cathedral in Bloemfontein.
==[[1894]]==
*[[17 February]]: Tolkien's younger brother [[Hilary Tolkien|Hilary]] is born.
==[[1895]]==
*[[April]]: Tolkien's mother [[Mabel Tolkien|Mabel]] moves with her sons from South Africa to [[Birmingham]], England.
==[[1896]]==
*[[15 February]]: Tolkien's father [[Arthur Tolkien]] dies of rheumatic fever.
* Summer: Tolkien's mother moves with her sons to [[Sarehole]].
==[[1900]]==
* June: Tolkien's mother is received into the Catholic Church.
* September: Tolkien begins attending [[King Edward's School]].
==[[1902]]==
* Tolkien begins attending St. Philip's School.
* Father [[Francis Morgan]] of the [[Birmingham Oratory]] becomes a family friend of the Tolkiens.
==[[1903]]==
* [[January]] : Tolkien returns to King Edward's School, having won a Foundation Scholarship.
==[[1904]]==
* [[April]]: Mabel Tolkien is hospitalized with diabetes. Tolkien is sent to live with his aunt [[Jane Neave]].
* [[June]]: Mabel Tolkien partially recovers and goes, with her sons, to Rednal in Worcestershire to convalesce.
* [[14 November]]: Tolkien's mother dies after a relapse.
==[[1905]]==
* Tolkien and his brother go to live with their aunt Beatrice Suffield.
* Autumn: Tolkien meets his friend [[Christopher Wiseman]] at King Edward's.

==[[1908]]==
* Beginning of the year: Tolkien and Hilary move to the home of Louis Faulkner at [[37 Duchess Road]] in [[Birmingham]], where Tolkien meets [[Edith Bratt]].

==[[1909]]==
* Summer: Tolkien and Edith Bratt fall in love.
* [[December]]: Father [[Francis Morgan]] learns of Tolkien and Edith's relationship and demands that it cease. Tolkien fails to win a University scholarship at [[Oxford]].

==[[1910]]==
* [[January]]: Tolkien and his brother move into the home of Thomas Macsherry at 4 Highfield Road.
* [[21 January]]: Tolkien and Edith have a clandestine meeting, which Father Francis learns of. He forbids Tolkien from any contact with Edith until he turns 21.
* [[December]]: Tolkien wins a scholarship to Exeter College, Oxford.

== [[1911]] ==
* Summer: Tolkien and several friends form the [[T.C.B.S.]]
* [[October]]: Tolkien begins studying at Exeter College, [[Oxford]].

== [[1915]] ==

* Tolkien graduates Oxford University with first-class honours.
* [[15 July]]: Tolkien is commissioned as second lieutenant in the Lancashire Fusiliers

==[[1916]]==
*[[22 March]]: Tolkien marries [[Edith Tolkien|Edith Bratt.]]
==[[1917]]==
* [[16 November]]: Birth of Tolkien's oldest son [[John Tolkien|John]].
==[[1920]]==

* Autumn: Tolkien becomes a reader in English language at the [[University of Leeds]].

* [[22 October]]: Birth of Tolkien's second son [[Michael Tolkien|Michael]].
* [[November]]: Tolkien leaves the army retaining his rank of lieutenant.
==[[1924]]==
* [[21 November]]: Birth of Tolkien's third son [[Christopher Tolkien|Christopher]].

== [[1925]] ==

* Return to Oxford as [[Rawlinson and Bosworth Professor of Anglo-Saxon]] and then Merton Professor of English Language and Literature 

==[[1929]]==
* [[18 June]]: Birth of Tolkien's daughter [[Priscilla Tolkien|Priscilla]].
==[[1937]]==
*[[21 September]]: Publication of ''[[The Hobbit]]''.
==[[1954]]==
*[[29 July]]: Publication of ''[[The Fellowship of the Ring]]''.
*[[11 November]]: Publication of ''[[The Two Towers]]''.
==[[1955]]==
*[[20 October]]: Publication of ''[[The Return of the King]]''.

== [[1959]] ==

* Tolkien retires from Oxford.

==[[1971]]==
*[[29 November]]: Tolkien's wife Edith dies at the age of 82.

== [[1972]] ==

* Tolkien is made a Commander of the [[Order of the British Empire]]
* Tolkien receives an honorary Doctorate of Letters from Oxford University.

==[[1973]]==
*[[2 September]]: J.R.R. Tolkien dies at the age of 81.

[[Category:Events (real-world)]]
